pullRequest.body:
A new file is created because `SimpleRing/Basic` contains a basic result `RingHom.injective` so that a new file is created to avoid a large amount of files importing `Algebra/Ring/Equiv.lean` and `RingTheory/TwoSidedIdeal/Operations`.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [c9579b5672](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21292/commits/c9579b5672f84c375d906996a1c7b2e4049db9bc)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.SimpleRing.Congr` (new file)|675|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ _root_.RingEquiv.mapTwoSidedIdeal`
`+ _root_.RingEquiv.mapTwoSidedIdeal_apply`
`+ _root_.RingEquiv.mapTwoSidedIdeal_symm`
`+ comap_comap`
`+ comap_le_comap`
`+ of_ringEquiv`
`+ of_surjective`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
cc @Whysoserioushah
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

There are still two comments, but otherwise LGTM, thanks!

bors d+

:v: jjaassoonn can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Thanks @Whysoserioushah! bors r+
bors r-
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13572714643/job/37941504512)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13572714643/job/37941504124)
Thanks!
Isn't surjectivity enough? If `A â†’+* B` is surjective and `A` is simple, than there are only two possibilities for the kernel of `f`.

LGTM except for the comment above.
maintainer delegate
Probably this should have simps now

I am a bit hesitated to add a `simps` as it exposes the underlying `RingCon`, I hope people should be more interested  in `mem_comap` below. To make up for the lack of `simps`, I will add a separate lemma for `monotone` part
Maybe I should add `simps` attribute, then manually make them not `simp` lemma? What do you think @Ruben-VandeVelde
I would imagine this needs simps as well
Again, I don't want to expose the `RingCon`, so I will manually add some lemma instead
Perhaps call it `RingEquiv.mapTwoSidedIdeal` to enable dot notation?
changed!
My first thought was that the LHS is simpler here (and so maybe it would be better if it was the RHS), but I'm not sure.
I will listen to you and change the name to `comap_comap`
looks good! LGTM! ðŸ‘
Could you please also include the following statement: a surjective ring hom `R ->+* S`, with `R` simple and `S` nontrivial implies that `S` is simple.
added!
`f` can be implicit here. I would remove the following lemma, that is now a special case.
I think we should keep that because this needs `Nontrivial S`.
but the following lemma is on `NonUnitalNonAssocRing` and also doesn't assume `Nontrivial S`
this `surjective` is on `NonAssocRing`
Ah yes, sorry. Let's keep it!
The main result is now with surjectivity.
sure I'll add it
added

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/SimpleRing/Congr): simpleness is preserved by ring isomorphism
